website_summaries.verdict: The heating source for these gloves is chemical, not electrical. Many users find the extended hours of steady warmth preferable to variable battery-powered heaters. Attractive price point.
pros: Do not use expensive electronics or batteries
Mitten section can be flipped back
Holds HotHands inserts securely in place
cons: Heat does not reach the fingertips
Mobility can be affected by two-layer design

customer_reviews.title: They’d be good if I were a lumberjack
customer_reviews.text: But I’m a little old lady. I just wanted them to wear around town when I’m out and about, but these are so big and klutzy I can’t imagine how I could use them for everyday. Also, I thought these would have pockets for the hand warmers on the palm and top, but it’s just the top. I have reynauds, I’ll need more than that. I’m going to improvise pockets on my usual lighter weight gloves, as I originally planned. I do think they are made well and would be good for playing in the snow but I’m in Southern California, not much occasion for that!
customer_reviews.author: desertwiffie

customer_reviews.title: Super Warm
customer_reviews.text: These are nice gloves. I love that I can stuff my hot hands in them. They run really big or they don’t come in ladies sizes. They’re really thick and are great for an outdoor walk or for keeping hands warm while watching a game. I wear mine while at the barn and for riding. The material has begun to pill. I wouldn’t recommend them for outdoor hard work but they’re super warm!!
customer_reviews.author: Akitamom2000

customer_reviews.title: Amazing warmth without hand warmers placed inside !
customer_reviews.text: My hands are very sensitive to cold so I have trouble getting gloves that keep me warm. Unbelievably to me, these gloves keep me warm in freezing temperatures and that is without the hand warmers inserted. I ran today in 18 degree temperature and I still did not need the hand warmers inserted. Surprisingly, these gloves are warmer than my sheepskin gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Bish

customer_reviews.title: Awesome gloves. Practical and necessary
customer_reviews.text: It’s just now getting cold in my area but these gloves are awesome. As of now I have not used a hot hands insert but so far have not needed to. These gloves cut the wind and are quite warm. The mitten aspect just adds another dimension to keep your fingers warm. I ordered a medium and I am a 5’8” female and they fit just fine. I look forward to using them in the colder months and will keep updating the review as winter moves in. These are a great value for the price my only question is why don’t they have them in colors.
customer_reviews.author: bevm

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: The best gloves I’ve ever bought. They have two pockets to use hand warmers that make them useful for people with Raynaud’s. Even though the medium size is kinda big for mu hands, they make my hands warm in a better way than any gloves I’ve tried before. Bad thing: I don’t know what happened with the touchable surface, it doesn’t work anymore...
customer_reviews.author: Angela Martin

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would be perfect for those cold mornings when I play pickleball (racquet game). I put them on and within 5 minutes I had to take them off. For one they were quite bulky, but since I was using it on the hand that doesn't hold a racquet I thought they would work to keep my hand warm, but they kept flopping over. They need a snap or something to secure the flap. I did not put the warm packet in because I wanted to see how they worked without it. Ended up returning.
customer_reviews.author: G. Peterson

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT WORK WELL
customer_reviews.text: So, bought these because hot hands are great. On these gloves, flaps do not stay closed, mittens usually fold down and you only have glove fingers showing. Hate to give bad reviews, but bought these for my Thanksgiving 2018 trip to Alaska and they sucked!
customer_reviews.author: Sean Jarvah

customer_reviews.title: Great for neuropathy sufferers
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for a family member who has neuropathy following a liver transplant. His hands are always cold which limits his outdoor activities even in a mild Pacific NW climate. He loves these gloves and they work well for him. It would be nice if the price could be lower. Most patients who could really benefit from using them might not be able to afford them.

customer_reviews.title: Torn on first use

product_meta.title: HotHands Heated Fleece Glove / Mittens
product_meta.description:
HotHands Heated Apparel helps keep the body warm and comfortable in the outdoors when the temperature drops! Specifically made with special pockets to fit HotHands warmers, this outdoor apparel is designed for comfort and providing long lasting heat. The ultimate way to stay comfortable outdoors when the weather gets cold! 

Features: 
- Designed specifically for use with HotHands warmers 
- Integrated pockets to hold HotHands warmers in place 
- Long lasting heat for hands and fingers 
- TruGrip leather palm 
- Elastic cuff for easy on and off 
- Includes a free pair of warmers! 

When to use it? 
- Outdoor Sports 
- Hunting & Fishing 
- Camping & Hiking 
- Working in the yard

Long lasting heat for hands and fingers
PRO-TEXT touch sensitive technology for electronic devices
Includes a free pair of HotHands warmers!
